results.title: The Jolifou inn
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Colin Low
results.brief_description: Canada of a hundred years ago seen through the paintings of Cornelius Krieghoff, celebrated Dutch artist and adventurer. The changing seasons, the untamed beauty of the Quebec countryside and the French settlers among whom he lived were an unending source of inspiration to Krieghoff, whose work is a colourful record of French-Canadian life in the mid-19th century. Photography by Lyle Enright and Douglas Roberts. Edited by Colin Low. Music by Louis Applebaum. (Awards: Yorkton; Bilbao; Toronto; Kootenay)

results.title: The Joker to the thief
results.brief_description: A surreal hand-drawn computer animation of a thief who steals his way into a mediaeval castle. Filled with hallucenogenic imagery the thief is surrounded by magic, scenes of madness and other horrors. He attempts to flee but is followed by the joker equipped with his tricks.

results.title: The Joke = Zert [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Milos Stejskal, Smida-Fikar Productions, Filmove Studio Barrandov and Jaromil Jires
results.brief_description: Based on Milan Kundera’s novel “The Unbearable Lightness of Being”, “The Joke” is a blunt parable about the Stalinist era’s absurd insistence that every individual must, at every moment, act with the political party in mind. In the early 1950s, Louis Jahn’s studies, career and life have been disrupted beyond repair as a result of a “politically incorrect” joke he played. Fifteen years later, Louis sees a unique chance to revenge himself upon the Communist party official that bought him down. But the times have changed and life proves to be more complicated than he had expected. Jaromil Jires was one of the preeminent Czech directors of the period, and “The Joke” was one of the key works of the Czech New Wave, a highly politicised film movement that emerged in the 1960s only to be savagely repressed by the Soviet invasion of Czechoslavakia in 1968. “The Joke” was finished just before the Soviet tanks moved in to Prague and was condemned by the new government. As a result the film went largely unseen, even in its own country, for nearly two decades.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Milos Stejskal, Smida-Fikar Productions, Filmove Studio Barrandov and Jaromil Jires

results.title: The Jointed-legged animals: arthropods
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
This film shows the jointed-legged animals and the structural and functional characteristics of animals in the phylum arthropoda: examples from each of the five classes, and their evolutionary development. Metamorphosis and moulting processes are illustrated using photo-micrography and time-lapse photography. The economic importance to man is discussed. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The John Thomas show
results.creator_credit: Denise Eriksen, Bruce Permezel, Beyond Productions and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Problem with men”.
Bryan Dawe and John Clarke introduce the delicate areas of impotence and testicular cancer. Testicular cancer can be treated early if picked up through self examination - if left, removal is the only option. Men who have had a testicle removed discuss if, and how the surgery and treatment has affected their lives. They also postulate on why self examination does not receive the same coverage that women’s self examination does. Meanwhile, impotence sufferers and their partners describe their experiences and medical professionals go through the pros and cons of vacuum pumps, self injection and where impotence treatment is heading. We are also shown how to examine for testicular abnormalities.

results.title: The John Marsden video
results.creator_credit: Christine McCaul Gleitzman, Mark Waters and Insight Profile
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Insight profile”.
Author John Marsden discusses the theories behind writing a successful novel. Using examples from his own work, he explores the different writing styles he uses in his own works, the way the characters think, and the motivating factors which make the characters come to life on the page. Also includes discussion on sentence structure, imagery, and how to select the right words to captivate the reader.

results.title: The Jogger
results.creator_credit: Perk Productions, Atlantis Films and Steve Karp
results.brief_description: A middle-aged male jogger runs alone thorugh snow-covered Central Park as “the metaphor” for the break-up of a marriage. A dialogue beginning before the marriage and tracing its dissolution, is heard throughout the run. The man’s adult life is traced by the dialogue and raises many questions for the viewer about life and human relations.

results.title: The Job for you
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Alan Anderson
results.brief_description: The Commonwealth Employment Service established shortly after World War II, aims at finding a job suitable for the person and a person suitable for the job. Each district office has an up to date list of vacancies in its own and in other areas. Finding specialists for professional employment, placing handicapped people in work and arranging employment for migrants are important aspects of the work, and play their part in building Australia’s future.

results.title: The Job
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, ABC-TV (Australia) and Michael Jenkins
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Scales of Justice Series”.
The Job is a story of naivety. Probationary Constable Leonard Webber has the makings of a good policeman, but his ideals bring him into conflict with his colleagues. His lack of experience makes him vulnerable and his training has not prepared him for the system, how it works and the rationalisation of the double dealings. Rated: M
